name: IRSS
title: International Retinoblastoma Staging System
notes:
**Note 1:** This SSDI is effective for diagnosis years 2023+
* For cases diagnosed 2018-2022, leave this SSDI blank

**Note 2:** Registrar is required to assign International Retinoblastoma Staging System (IRSS) based on the criteria provided in this data item.
* If a physician documents the International Retinoblastoma Staging System (IRSS), document this in the text field, but don’t use that to code this data item

**Note 3:** If there is bilateral disease, code the most advanced stage at diagnosis.
footnotes: (1)	Aitken JF, Youlden D, O’Neill L, Gupta S, Frazier AL, eds. Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines – Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.
rows:
Stage 0: 
* Tumor confined to the globe
* Enucleation has not been performed
* Patient treated conservatively with either focal therapies or chemotherapy

Stage I: 
* Enucleation with negative margins (R0)
   - Completely resected histologically

Stage II
* Enucleation with positive/microscopic residual tumor

Stage III: 
* Regional extension 
   - Orbit
   - Preauricular extension
   - Cervical lymph node involvement

Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
(If this information is required by your standard setter, use of code 8 may result in an edit error.)

Not documented in medical record
International Retinoblastoma Staging System (IRSS) not assessed or unknown if assessed
N/A - Diagnosis year is prior to 2023
